verses.text: 安息日的主有一個安息日，耶穌從麥田經過，他的門徒摘了麥穗，用手搓著吃。

words.note: Lit. 'rest day'
Lit. 'rest day'

verses.text: 有幾個法利賽人說：「你們為甚麼作安息日不可作的事呢？」
耶穌回答：「大衛和跟他在一起的人，在飢餓的時候所作的，你們沒有念過嗎？

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase with a verb (所作 = 'that which was done')

verses.text: 他不是進了 神的殿，吃了陳設餅，也給跟他在一起的人吃嗎？這餅除了祭司以外，別的人是不可以吃的。」

words.note: Refers to the monotheistic God; often capitalized or raised in Chinese Bibles.
The bread placed before God in the tabernacle/temple.

verses.text: 他又對他們說：「人子是安息日的主。」

words.note: A title Jesus used for himself, emphasizing his humanity and messianic role.
Lit. 'rest day'

verses.text: 治好手枯的人另一個安息日，耶穌進入會堂教導人，在那裡有一個人，右手枯乾，

words.note: Refers to a hand that has become dry and shriveled.
Lit. 'rest day'.
Jewish place of worship and community gathering.
Describes a limb that has lost its vitality and shriveled.

verses.text: 經學家和法利賽人要看他會不會在安息日治病，好找把柄控告他。

words.note: Lit. 'scripture scholar'.
Jewish religious and political party in ancient Judea.
A-not-A question structure.
Verb-object compound, often used as a single verb.
Figuratively, something to use against someone.

verses.text: 耶穌知道他們的意念，就對那一隻手枯乾了的人說：「起來，站在當中！」那人就起來站著。

words.note: Often refers to inner thoughts or motives.
Indicates upward movement or beginning an action.
Indicates a sustained state or action.

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說：「我問你們：在安息日哪一樣是可以作的呢：作好事還是壞事？救命還是害命？」

words.note: Verb-object compound, used as an idiom 'Help!' or 'Save life'.
Verb-object compound.

verses.text: 他環視周圍所有的人，就對那人說：「伸出你的手來！」他把手一伸，手就復原了。

words.note: Verb-complement structure indicating outward direction.
Indicates movement towards the speaker or for emphasis.
Introduces the object of a verb, indicating it is acted upon.
Used before a verb to denote immediacy: 'as soon as X, then Y'.
Lit. 'return to original state'.

verses.text: 他們卻大怒，彼此商議怎樣對付耶穌。
選立十二使徒在那些日子，有一次耶穌出去到山上禱告，整夜禱告 神。

words.note: Lit. 'sent disciple'
Often used in religious contexts.
Often used in religious contexts.
Refers to the Christian God.

verses.text: 天亮以後，他把門徒叫來，從他們中間挑選了十二個人，稱他們為使徒，

words.note: Lit. 'school follower' or 'gate follower'
Lit. 'sent disciple'

verses.text: 就是西門，和他弟弟安得烈，以及雅各、約翰、腓力、巴多羅邁、
馬太、多馬、亞勒腓的兒子雅各、稱為激進派的西門、

words.note: Refers to the Zealot sect.

verses.text: 雅各的兒子猶大，和出賣主的加略人猶大。
論福論禍耶穌和他們下了山，站在平地上，有一大群門徒同他在一起，又有一大批從猶太全地、耶路撒冷和推羅、西頓海邊來的人。

words.note: Refers to the discourse on blessings and curses.
Refers to a student or follower, especially in religious context.

verses.text: 他們要聽他講道，也要他們的疾病得醫好。還有一些被污靈纏擾的也痊愈了。

words.note: Refers specifically to preaching religious doctrine.

verses.text: 群眾都設法摸他，因為有能力從他身上出來，治好眾人。

words.note: Refers to 'on his person' or 'from within him'.

verses.text: 耶穌抬頭看著門徒，說：「貧窮的人有福了，因為 神的國是你們的。

words.definition: to raise one's head, look up

words.note: The leading space or raised dot (　) indicates reverence for God.

verses.text: 飢餓的人有福了，因為你們要得飽足。哀哭的人有福了，因為你們將要喜樂。

words.note: Lit. 'have blessing'
Lit. 'have blessing'

verses.text: 世人為人子的緣故憎恨你們、排斥你們、辱罵你們，棄絕你們的名好像棄絕惡物，你們就有福了。

words.note: A title Jesus used for himself.
Lit. 'have blessing'

verses.text: 那時你們應該歡喜跳躍，因為你們在天上的賞賜是大的，他們的祖先對待先知也是這樣。

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows first'.

verses.text: 「然而你們富有的人有禍了，因為你們已經得了你們的安慰。

words.note: Lit. 'have calamity'.

verses.text: 你們飽足的人有禍了，因為你們將要飢餓。你們喜樂的人有禍了，因為你們將要痛哭。

words.note: Lit. 'have calamity'.
Lit. 'have calamity'.

verses.text: 人都說你們好的時候，你們就有禍了，因為你們的祖先對待假先知也是這樣。

words.note: Often used in the phrase '有禍了' (you have woe).

verses.text: 當愛仇敵「只是我告訴你們聽道的人：當愛你們的仇敵，善待恨你們的人。

words.note: Indicates a moral imperative or command.
Indicates a moral imperative or command.

verses.text: 咒詛你們的，要為他們祝福，凌辱你們的，要為他們禱告。

words.note: Verb-object compound meaning 'to offer a prayer'.

verses.text: 有人打你一邊的臉，把另一邊也轉給他打；有人拿你的外衣，連內衣也讓他拿去。

words.note: Used in 'bǎ' structures to move object before verb.

verses.text: 向你求的，就給他；有人拿去你的東西，不用再要回來。

words.note: Here, '向你求的' means 'one who asks of you'.
Literally 'east-west', a common word for 'thing'.

verses.text: 你們願意人怎樣待你們，你們就應當怎樣待人。
如果單愛那些愛你們的人，那有甚麼好處呢？罪人也愛那些愛他們的人。
如果只善待那些善待你們的人，那有甚麼好處呢？罪人也會這樣行。
如果借給人，又指望向人收回，那有甚麼好處呢？罪人也借給罪人，要如數收回。
你們要愛仇敵，善待他們；借出去，不要指望償還；這樣你們的賞賜就大了，你們也必作至高者的兒子，因為 神自己也寬待忘恩的和惡人。

words.note: A title for God in the Bible.
The elevated character 　神 is used in some Bibles for reverence.

verses.text: 你們要仁慈像你們的父仁慈一樣。

words.note: Refers to a virtuous, God-like quality.
Refers to God the Father.
Refers to a virtuous, God-like quality.

verses.text: 不可判斷「你們不要判斷人，就必不受判斷；不要定人的罪，就必不被定罪；要饒恕人，就必蒙饒恕；

words.note: Verb-object compound meaning 'to find guilty/condemn'.
Often used for receiving blessings or favor.

verses.text: 要給人，就必有給你們的；並且要用十足的升斗，連按帶搖，上尖下流地倒在你們懷裡；因為你們用甚麼升斗量給人，就必用甚麼升斗量給你們。」

words.note: Forms a noun phrase 'that which is given to you'.
Ancient unit of dry measure.
Idiomatic description of filling a measure to capacity.
Idiomatic description of a measure piled high and running over.
Ancient unit of dry measure.
Ancient unit of dry measure.

verses.text: 耶穌又用比喻對他們說：「瞎子怎能給瞎子領路呢？兩個人不都要掉在坑裡嗎？

words.note: Used in rhetorical questions, implying 'both will'.

words.definition: in the pit, into the ditch

verses.text: 學生不能勝過老師，所有學成的，不過和老師一樣。

words.note: Refers to a disciple in a religious context.

words.definition: to surpass, to be superior to

words.note: Refers to a master or rabbi in a religious context.
Forms a noun phrase 'those who are fully trained'.
Refers to a master or rabbi in a religious context.

verses.text: 為甚麼看得見你弟兄眼中的木屑，卻想不到自己眼中的梁木呢？

words.note: Refers to a fellow believer in Christian contexts.
Metaphorical for minor fault.
Metaphorical for a major fault.

verses.text: 你不看見自己眼中的梁木，怎能對你弟兄說：『弟兄，容我除去你眼中的木屑』呢？偽君子啊！先去掉自己眼中的梁木，才能看得清楚，好去掉弟兄眼中的木屑。

words.note: Lit. 'false gentleman'.

verses.text: 壞樹不能結好果子「因為好樹不能結壞果子，壞樹不能結好果子。

words.note: Metaphorical for deeds or results in a religious context.

verses.text: 憑著果子就可以認出樹來。人不能從荊棘上採無花果，也不能從蒺藜裡摘葡萄。

words.note: Used here as a directional complement indicating 'outwards' or 'to light'.

verses.text: 良善的人從心中所存的良善發出良善，邪惡的人從心中所存的邪惡發出邪惡；因為心中所充滿的，口裡就說出來。

words.note: Indicates the object of the following verb, often implying 'that which is...'

verses.text: 聽道要行道「你們為甚麼稱呼我『主啊！主啊！』卻不遵行我的吩咐呢？

words.note: Often used in religious contexts regarding divine commands.
Refers to a superior's command; frequently in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 每一個到我跟前，聽我的話並且去行的，我要指示你們他像甚麼人。
他像一個人建造房屋，挖深了地，把根基建在磐石上。大水氾濫的時候，急流沖擊那房屋，不能使它動搖，因為它建造得好。

words.note: Introduces the object before the verb.
Figuratively, a strong and stable foundation.
Refers to a large body of water, often a flood in biblical context.
Indicates the manner or result of an action.

verses.text: 但那聽見而不遵行的，就像人在地上建屋，沒有根基，急流一沖，就立刻倒塌，毀壞得很厲害。」

words.note: Used with another verb to mean 'as soon as... then...'
Indicates the degree or result of an action.
